intro: Perilla frutescens var. typica, commonly known as shiso, is an annual herb native to East Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves, which are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are either green or purple in color. It produces small, pale purple flowers arranged in spikes, followed by oval, brown seeds. The leaves and seeds contain compounds such as rosmarinic acid and perillaldehyde, contributing to its distinctive flavor and potential health benefits.
